messages.message:
Hey all :wave: we’ve been migrating File System operations from V1 to V2 API.
We’re doing a bug bash before the upcoming release, but a heads up in case this introduces bugs in dev/dogfood for you.

If you face issues with any of the following file operations, please let me know. Thanks! :)
• Create file
• Create directory
• Get file metadata / stat
• Duplicate files
• Unzip
• Read file
• Write file
is downloading a large folder an extension of read file?
@Charles Downloading a folder is technically wrapped by read file calls internally, but that is a webapp endpoint not an API endpoint, so is orthogonal to this change.

could you translate more laymans terms for me? :sweat_smile: orthogonal meaning the underlying read file is updated to v2, but the problem still exisits because of the webapp endpoint and not the api endpoint?

The problem of downloading large folder won't go away before we migrate the webapp endpoint off python stack as far as I understand. I meant to clarify that the changes Song made does not affect the current behavior of downloading large folder :slightly_smiling_face: So the existing problems will stay
gotcha, understood now thanks for clarifying!
